page.title: 12HOUSES GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE
page.content: There are some very old houses of handmade bricks retaining their original external appearance. Others have been faced or whitened. Roseacre has a few interesting houses; most are 100 to 150 years old. The farm houses are very large with attics and cellars. Two built since 1948 have tablets inscribed "Queen Anne's Bounty". This chartiy, set up in 1703 to aid poor clergy, was amalgamated with the Church Commissioners, the then owners of teh properties, in 1948. Some farm cottages still remain tied for farm workers only; others are let.
